Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: Lin McAdam (James Stewart) pursues notorious outlaw Henry "Dutch" Brown (Millard Mitchell) into Dodge City, Kansas. There, in an effort to flush out the criminal, McAdam enters a sharp-shooting contest and wins the top prize: the eponymous Winchester rifle. Brown, desiring the rifle for himself, sneaks into McAdam's room and makes off with it. After finding the rifle missing, McAdam chases Brown across the state and toward an epic confrontation.

programme.title: One-Eyed Jacks
programme.desc: After pulling a bank heist in Mexico, the outlaw Rio (Marlon Brando) and his partner, Dad Longworth (Karl Malden), make a run for it, but Dad has bigger plans than freedom. He betrays Rio and absconds with the loot, and Rio ends up in prison. Years pass before Rio finally breaks free to enact his long-plotted revenge. Tracking Dad to California, Rio learns he's become a sheriff -- which is no deterrent -- but when Rio falls for Dad's stepdaughter, Louisa (Pina Pellicer), he has second thoughts.

The couple move to the supposedly idyllic Cottonwood -- only to find that their new home has been overrun by a rogue rancher who has unfinished business with Frame.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: Texans Tom (Robert Sterling) and Jeff Cloud (John Barrymore Jr.) find a corpse on their ranch. Earl Boyce (Jack Elam) saw who killed the man, but he's too frightened to tell. Outlaw Kid Wichita (Robert Preston), another Cloud brother, comes to town to offer his services. After catching some local ranchers messing around with Tom's cattle, he steals the men's saddles. From there, things deteriorate into kidnapping, gang wars and murder, and the line between hero and villain becomes blurred.

programme.desc: Lin McAdam (James Stewart) pursues notorious outlaw Henry "Dutch" Brown (Millard Mitchell) into Dodge City, Kansas. There, in an effort to flush out the criminal, McAdam enters a sharp-shooting contest and wins the top prize: the eponymous Winchester rifle. Brown, desiring the rifle for himself, sneaks into McAdam's room and makes off with it. After finding the rifle missing, McAdam chases Brown across the state and toward an epic confrontation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas becomes involved in the family troubles of the hotel clerk.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Gold seekers driven from an abandoned mine on the Cannon ranch return to take revenge; guest Leo Gordon.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Dr. Mike Murdock.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Christian success coach Dr. Dave Martin.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Christian success coach Dr. Dave Martin.

programme.title: Mike Murdock - School of Wisdom
programme.desc: Biblical principles of wisdom that help individuals face life's successes.

programme.title: David Jeremiah
programme.desc: In this weekly program, Dr. David Jeremiah delivers practical messages to the congregation at the Shadow Mountain Community Church in San Diego. Also featured is music from the Shadow Mountain Community Church Choir and Orchestra, as well as performances by musical guests that have included Steve Green and Charles Billingsley. Men and women who have been impacted by the Turning Point ministry also share their stories with viewers. During the month of December, "Turning Point" usually features special Christmas programming.

programme.title: In Touch With Dr. Charles Stanley
programme.desc: Dr. Charles Stanley, pastor of the First Baptist Church in Atlanta, shares his insights on Christian faith and enlightens viewers with spiritual motivation.

programme.title: Michael Youssef
programme.desc: Passionately proclaiming God's word to people around the world through the ministries of Leading The Way.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: A runaway farm boy (Brandon de Wilde) who learns how to be a cowpoke by observing a veteran hand (James Gregory) during a cattle drive.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: A man (Andrew Prine) seeking to free his bondmaid sister plans to steal an arms shipment bound for Boonesborough.

programme.title: Daniel Boone
programme.desc: Boone and a hermit (Jeff Morrow) help a woman (Julie Harris) who Creeks believe is a witch.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Cliff Rexford (Michael Witney) reveals that the Rev. Watson (Glenn Corbett) killed his brother in a gunfight.

programme.title: Riders of the Purple Sage
programme.desc: Betrayal forces a woman (Amy Madigan) struggling to run her Old West ranch to turn to a mysterious drifter (Ed Harris).

programme.title: Destry
programme.desc: Dishonest mayor Hiram J. Sellers (Edgar Buchanan) and powerful criminal Phil Decker (Lyle Bettger) dominate a small western town. But when the town's sheriff dies under mysterious circumstances, Tom Destry (Audie Murphy), son of a famed gunman, is called in to put an end to the corruption. Destry surprises the townsfolk, however, by preaching pacifism -- until he begins investigating the death of the previous sheriff and realizes that his words may not be enough.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Jim Hardie is ordered to infiltrate Sam Bass' gang so that he can learn where they hole up between raids.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Jim Hardie is called in to investigate what happened to a long overdue stagecoach; among passengers were the son of a wealthy rancher and his fiancee.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A seriously wounded trail hand rejects Matt's offer of help and is determined to seek his own revenge on his attacker.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Chester is forced to be both guardian and nurse to a runaway Indian who has been befriended by a lonely white woman.

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Virgil Cole (Ed Harris) and his longtime friend and partner Everett Hitch (Viggo Mortensen) travel the 1880s Southwest, bringing justice to lawless towns desperate enough to hire them. In the mining town of Appaloosa, malevolent rancher Randall Bragg and his cronies ride roughshod over the frightened citizens. As Cole and Hitch work to end Bragg's reign of terror, an unconventional widow (Renee Zellweger) arrives, complicating the job and threatening their bond.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: During a heavy snowstorm Matt seeks shelter in a prairie cabin and encounters two bank robbers.

programme.title: Law and Order
programme.desc: Wild West lawman Frame Johnson (Ronald Reagan) arrests a notorious outlaw, but, after the locals threaten to break into the prison and hang the crook without a trial, Frame gets fed up with injustice. He decides to put his days of gunslinging behind him in favor of a simple domestic life with his lover, Jeannie (Dorothy Malone). The couple move to the supposedly idyllic Cottonwood -- only to find that their new home has been overrun by a rogue rancher who has unfinished business with Frame.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: Texans Tom (Robert Sterling) and Jeff Cloud (John Barrymore Jr.) find a corpse on their ranch. Earl Boyce (Jack Elam) saw who killed the man, but he's too frightened to tell. Outlaw Kid Wichita (Robert Preston), another Cloud brother, comes to town to offer his services. After catching some local ranchers messing around with Tom's cattle, he steals the men's saddles. From there, things deteriorate into kidnapping, gang wars and murder, and the line between hero and villain becomes blurred.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Fallen ill, a couple seeks shelter with Lucas.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: With Dr. Mike Murdock.

programme.title: Campmeeting
programme.desc: Trust God for your breakthrough. Enter into powerful worship! Join us for Campmeeting.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Fear pervades Dodge City when a private railroad coach containing a victim of spotted fever is quarantined.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: John is unable to buy Mexican beef to fulfill a contract because ranchers are forced to sell to a ruthless buyer.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: A disturbed Civil War veteran, a former friend of Buck's, takes Buck, Victoria, Manolito and Don Sebastian prisoner at the ranch.

programme.title: The Life and Passion of Christ
programme.desc: Vivid details enhance a portrait of the birth, life, death and resurrection of Jesus of Nazareth, focusing on the star of Bethlehem, his infancy in Egypt, his encounters with the San Hedrin and Pilate, and his crucifixion.

programme.title: Upheaval: The Journey of Menachem Begin
programme.desc: Imagery, rarely seen archival materials and interviews provide insight into the life and history of former Israeli Prime Minister Menachem Begin.

programme.title: The Big Focus
programme.desc: John Bachman focuses on the biggest news from D.C., N.Y., and around America.

programme.title: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano
programme.desc: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano.

programme.title: The Trump Wars
programme.desc: Exposing Fake News No one else in the world understands what the news media has become more than President Donald Trump; he fights them on their level, and more often than not, he wins; reliving his best moments taking on fake news.

programme.title: Stand Up Trump: Making America Fun Again
programme.desc: The Trump Train During his presidential campaign, Donald Trump waged the kind of political war unseen in modern history.

programme.title: Watched! Big Government Is Watching, Listening, and Monitoring Almost Everything You Do
programme.desc: Constitutional rights.

programme.title: Woke America
programme.desc: The left is on a campaign to transform America forever. Common sense and traditional values are being trampled. Examines who's behind this dangerous movement.

programme.title: Blue to Red: The Shifting of America
programme.desc: The massive migration from blue to red states post-COVID-19 is examined, and the possible unintended consequences.

programme.title: The Chris Salcedo Weekend
programme.desc: Conservative, liberty-loving host Chris Salcedo hits press bias and both political parties.

programme.title: Rob Schmitt This Week
programme.desc: Rob Schmitt wraps up all the latest news and opinion, and sets the stage for tomorrow.

programme.title: Newsfront
programme.desc: Antisemitism in America The normalization of antisemitism in America by politicians and public figures leads to unprecedented attacks against the Jewish community.

programme.title: The Big Focus
programme.desc: John Bachman focuses on the biggest news from D.C., N.Y., and around America.

programme.title: The Record with Greta Van Susteren Weekly
programme.desc: Greta Van Susteren gives the big news from D.C., N.Y., across America, and around the world.

programme.title: Newsmax News In-Depth
programme.desc: Bianca de la Garza looks at the big stories of the week, politics, policy, the economy and much more.

programme.title: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano
programme.desc: The Freedom File: Judge Napolitano.

programme.title: Josef Mengele: Hunting a Nazi Criminal
programme.desc: He was one of the most notorious Nazi war criminals, infamous for his deadly experiments on twins. But at the end of WWII, he simply disappeared. Despite a global manhunt by Mossad and the allies, he would die a free man, 34 years later, in Brazil.

programme.title: FBI: Abuse of Power
programme.desc: The FBI's raid of Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago created controversy; Rob Schmitt looks at the issues.

programme.title: Systematic Deception
programme.desc: This cutting edge documentary is inspired by the book The Black History Bible, written by film producer Lisa Babbage. Systematic Deception brings light to a generation of manipulation by the Democrat Party.

programme.title: King of Cool: The Dean Martin Story
programme.desc: Dean Martin was an undeniable singing, acting, and stage sensation. Newsmax celebrates the man behind the martini glass.

programme.title: Lee Greenwood: God Bless the USA!
programme.desc: Celebrities pay tribute to Lee Greenwood, his "God Bless the USA," and undying love of our military in an exclusive interview.

programme.title: The 80s: Decade of Decision
programme.desc: Greed was good during the decadent 80s, and so were big hair, big shoulders, and even bigger 401ks; the 80s was the era of Reaganomics, Rubik's Cube, Madonna, Rambo, the Macintosh, Mario Brothers, Chernobyl, flying DeLoreans, and so much more.

programme.title: The 90s: Decade of Change
programme.desc: With baby boomers coming of age, the 1990s usher in a new era of peace and prosperity in America.

programme.title: Presidents and UFOs: The Surprising Story
programme.desc: A history of UFO's and Presidents, from George Washington to Donald Trump, with expert testimony, interviews, and reports of personal encounters involving U.S. Presidents and unexplained paranormal phenomena.

programme.title: Alien Encounters: Roswell
programme.desc: Examining mysteries surrounding claims that an alien spacecraft crashed near Roswell, N.M., in 1947.

programme.title: Surviving Hitler's Mad Doctors
programme.desc: The Nazi Regime imposed some of the most heinous forms of eugenics the world ever witnessed; Nazi concentration camps conducted so-called "medical research projects" involving cruel and often lethal experimentation on human subjects.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A widower loses custody of his daughter; he accepts a job as hangman to earn money to get her back.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: While visiting Laramie, Daisy discovers a dead body on the floor down the hall from her hotel room, but she has trouble getting people to believe her when she identifies the killer.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Hardie stops a group of vigilante cowboys from hanging an accused cow rustler, only to learn that the young man he saved is notorious criminal Tom Horn.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: An armed gunman robs the stage agent in a sleepy town, and he seeks refuge in the home of an unsuspecting widow.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Festus kills a drunken sharpshooter in self-defense, then leaves town to avoid arrest.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A boy's intense love for the guitar that used to belong to his father leads to murder.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt helps a teenage girl defend her brother, who is being railroaded on a homicide charge.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history; after taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: An out-of-town sheriff accuses a man found wounded on the prairie of murder.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Three soldiers held for murder are victims of their commander's unprovoked attack on Indians.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: Tracking a man-killing cougar, Steve rests at a couple's (Jack Klugman, Joyce Bulifant) cabin, where the wife pursues him and the husband threatens.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who enjoys painting scenes of his life on the range until his new bride, Nancy, gives him the push he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on the artwork that will soon make him famous.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Caroline Casteel, captured many years ago by Indians, is traded back to a man who brings her to join the wagon train.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: When he plans to ride shotgun on a stage carrying a bank shipment, Jess is asked to look the other way and allow a robbery, but when Jess tries to have the man arrested, the office manager refuses to press charges.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Festus discovers that a rancher, not wolves, has been killing cattle.

programme.title: Bonanza

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A man (Gilbert Roland) loses his horse by court order, then is charged with murder when he fights to regain it.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: As Slim escorts young Virg Walker back to Laramie, it is discovered that Virg is using money from a stage coach robbery and murder.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne meets a professional killer named Preacher in a saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas' old friend arrives for an unexpected visit.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An old enemy of Marshal Micah Torrance's arrives in town, bent on revenge.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: John backs a competitor to an established freight hauler (Robert Clary) faking Indian attacks to raise prices.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: While on a scouting mission, Flint is stopped by a scavenger who tries to detour the wagon train into the path of a hidden cannon by saying that he has blasted a road through a dead end canyon that will save the train two weeks.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: A teacher traveling with the wagon train encounters conflict when he become attracted to the daughter of a preacher who has just joined the train.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: The townspeople ostracize a woman whose husband was acquitted of murder.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Jess saves a crippled Blackfoot youth from a scalp hunter despite the Army edict that forbids settlers from helping a member of the Blackfoot tribe.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: After serving a prison sentence, a young ex-con returns home on the Wells Fargo stage.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Hardie defends the town bum against accusations that he is a legendary outlaw incriminated in a recent shooting.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Festus tries his best to help when Doc Adams is bitten by a snake.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A bandit holds hostages inside a church while Doc Adams treats his wounds.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A con-man dying from a heart ailment arrives in Dodge City and helps save Matt's life.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A mixed-race Apache Indian reservation policeman tracks a band of renegades to Dodge City. While in the area, he visits his mother, who refuses to acknowledge him due to his race.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: A female writer becomes involved with an outlaw.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: After a bite from a rabid dog leaves him with little time to live, a Britisher (Leo Genn) embarks on a rescue mission to relieve his guilt over wartime cowardice.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City; Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wagon Train

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A professional gunfighter is hired to kill a businessman who is also courting the gunman's former wife.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: An outlaw's (Robert Wilke) tomboy daughter (Brenda Scott), placed in the Virginian's care, is torn between her devotion to injured Randy and her desire to help her father escape from jail.

programme.title: The Virginian
programme.desc: Randy's discovery of gold coins hidden in a cave on the Shiloh Ranch attracts visitors -- a government agent seeking Civil War loot and Randy's long-lost brother, who is wanted for murder.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: Cheyenne turns down the job of top hand for rancher Ben Gentry but finds two more offers awaiting him for the same job.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A marshal from another territory comes to North Fork looking for a wanted man.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An escaped killer barricades himself and his two companions in the North Fork general store.

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Manolito's hunt for excitement leads him to rob a bandit friend to help a woman (Elizabeth Allen) and her followers.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Flint leads a fragment of the wagon train on a dangerous route through a swamp that supposedly contains mysterious creatures.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: While crossing a sprawling ranch, trouble brews between two newlyweds and an interloper.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A mysterious, wealthy new woman in town competes for Kitty's business.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: Slim finds himself caught between an Army colonel and the Sioux nation when the colonel tries to force his agenda after Wounded Knee.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: Doc Bell, a former outlaw, becomes the chief suspect in a train robbery.

programme.title: Tales of Wells Fargo
programme.desc: An attractive woman suggests that her brother may not be the man Hardie should be investigating.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: An Indian girl defies the laws of her people to save her father.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: An outlaw is determined to free his brother from jail after a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: Lin McAdam (James Stewart) pursues notorious outlaw Henry "Dutch" Brown (Millard Mitchell) into Dodge City, Kansas. There, in an effort to flush out the criminal, McAdam enters a sharp-shooting contest and wins the top prize: the eponymous Winchester rifle. Brown, desiring the rifle for himself, sneaks into McAdam's room and makes off with it. After finding the rifle missing, McAdam chases Brown across the state and toward an epic confrontation.

programme.title: One-Eyed Jacks
programme.desc: After pulling a bank heist in Mexico, the outlaw Rio (Marlon Brando) and his partner, Dad Longworth (Karl Malden), make a run for it, but Dad has bigger plans than freedom. He betrays Rio and absconds with the loot, and Rio ends up in prison. Years pass before Rio finally breaks free to enact his long-plotted revenge. Tracking Dad to California, Rio learns he's become a sheriff -- which is no deterrent -- but when Rio falls for Dad's stepdaughter, Louisa (Pina Pellicer), he has second thoughts.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman; when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Seminole
programme.desc: Lt. Lance Caldwell (Rock Hudson) is sent to Fort King in Florida to serve under Maj. Harlan Degan (Richard Carlson), who wants to rid the area of the Native American Seminole tribe. This plan sits poorly with Caldwell, whose childhood friend -- and rival in his pursuit of the lovely Revere Muldoon (Barbara Hale) -- is the tribe's chief, Osceola (Anthony Quinn). Tension between the Seminole and the army rises, and, when a guard is killed at the fort, the lieutenant is blamed for the murder.

programme.title: Law and Order
programme.desc: Wild West lawman Frame Johnson (Ronald Reagan) arrests a notorious outlaw, but, after the locals threaten to break into the prison and hang the crook without a trial, Frame gets fed up with injustice. He decides to put his days of gunslinging behind him in favor of a simple domestic life with his lover, Jeannie (Dorothy Malone). The couple move to the supposedly idyllic Cottonwood -- only to find that their new home has been overrun by a rogue rancher who has unfinished business with Frame.

programme.title: The Sundowners
programme.desc: Texans Tom (Robert Sterling) and Jeff Cloud (John Barrymore Jr.) find a corpse on their ranch. Earl Boyce (Jack Elam) saw who killed the man, but he's too frightened to tell. Outlaw Kid Wichita (Robert Preston), another Cloud brother, comes to town to offer his services. After catching some local ranchers messing around with Tom's cattle, he steals the men's saddles. From there, things deteriorate into kidnapping, gang wars and murder, and the line between hero and villain becomes blurred.

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: Lin McAdam (James Stewart) pursues notorious outlaw Henry "Dutch" Brown (Millard Mitchell) into Dodge City, Kansas. There, in an effort to flush out the criminal, McAdam enters a sharp-shooting contest and wins the top prize: the eponymous Winchester rifle. Brown, desiring the rifle for himself, sneaks into McAdam's room and makes off with it. After finding the rifle missing, McAdam chases Brown across the state and toward an epic confrontation.
